title: The Unbearable Lightness of Morning
text: The alarm didn't go off. A strange, purple light pulses gently outside your window, humming a tune that sounds suspiciously like 80s synth-pop. Your head throbs. You need coffee. Urgently.

choices.label: Stumble towards the kitchen for coffee.

exit_line: The day has already made some questionable choices.

title: A Close Encounter of the Yard Kind
text: You peek through the blinds. A colossal, shimmering jellyfish is hovering over your neighbor's prize-winning petunias. It seems to be scanning them with a curious intensity. Weird. Anyway, coffee.
exit_line: Priorities are, after all, priorities.

title: The Path of True Desire
text: You wisely ignore the potential end of the world in favor of the more pressing crisis: a complete lack of caffeine in your system. The kitchen, your sanctuary, awaits.
exit_line: The aroma of potential coffee calls to you.

title: The Great Appliance Betrayal
where_when: The Kitchen. A moment of truth.
text: You reach the kitchen. The coffee maker, your beacon of hope, is dark. The little power light is off. You press the button. Nothing. You press it again, harder, as if that will help. The synth-pop humming is louder here.

choices.label: Curse the coffee maker and all its ancestors.

exit_line: This betrayal cuts deep.

title: A Puzzling Power Problem
text: You head to the basement. All the fuses are fine, but they're glowing with the same eerie purple light. This is definitely above your pay grade. You need coffee and an electrician, in that order.
exit_line: Time to head back to the scene of the crime.

title: Catharsis, then Contact
text: You unleash a string of creative insults at the inanimate object. It doesn't fix the problem, but you feel slightly better. A shimmering, translucent tentacle phases through the wall next to you.
exit_line: Well, that's not something you see every day.

title: First Contact, Second Thoughts
text: A vaguely jellyfish-shaped creature, shimmering with purple light, is now floating where your toaster used to be. It emits a series of clicks and whistles, which a small floating orb translates into a robotic voice: 'GREETINGS, CARBON-BASED MORNING PERSON.'

choices.label: Ask it if it knows what's wrong with the coffee maker.
Offer it a chair, then remember it's floating.

exit_line: Hospitality is tricky with non-corporeal beings.

title: A Direct Approach
text: 'AFFIRMATIVE,' the orb translates. 'WE HAVE TEMPORARILY DISABLED ALL NON-ESSENTIAL ELECTRONICS TO GAIN YOUR ATTENTION. YOUR BEAN-WATER DEVICE WAS DEEMED... NON-ESSENTIAL.' You feel a surge of profound indignation.
exit_line: They have declared war.

title: Awkward pleasantries
text: You gesture vaguely at a kitchen chair. 'SEATING IS... SUB-OPTIMAL FOR OUR PHYSIOLOGY. WE APPRECIATE THE GESTURE. WE ARE HERE TO DISCUSS A MATTER OF GRAVE IMPORTANCE.' It seems to gesture a tentacle at your dead coffee maker.
exit_line: The gravity of the situation is slowly dawning.

title: A Galactic Grievance
where_when: The kitchen, now an impromptu embassy.
text: 'YOUR PLANET HAS BEEN LEAKING... ENTERTAINMENT,' the orb buzzes. 'SPECIFICALLY, YOUR REALITY TELEVISION BROADCASTS. THEY HAVE REACHED OUR HOME WORLD AND ARE CAUSING... SOCIETAL DECAY.'

choices.label: Laugh. It has to be a joke.
Nod knowingly. That actually makes a lot of sense.

exit_line: You're starting to feel personally responsible for intergalactic corruption.

title: Poorly Timed Amusement
text: You let out a snort of laughter. The jellyfish creature flashes a deep, angry red. 'THE COLLAPSE OF OUR CIVILIZATION IS NOT A SOURCE OF HUMOR, PRIMATE.'
exit_line: Note to self: aliens have no sense of irony before 9 AM.

title: Shared Disappointment
text: You sigh and rub your temples. 'Yeah, I get it. It's pretty bad here, too.' The jellyfish seems to soften, glowing a more empathetic shade of lavender. 'YOUR EMPATHY IS NOTED.'
exit_line: You have bonded with an alien over a shared hatred of bad TV.

title: Exhibit A: The Real Housewives of Planet Glarzon
text: The orb projects a hologram showing jellyfish creatures in elaborate wigs throwing glasses of nutrient paste at each other. 'OUR YOUTH NOW ASPIRE TO BECOME 'INFLUENCERS' AND 'TABLE-FLIPPERS.' IT IS UTTER CHAOS.'

choices.label: 'Can we please just turn the coffee maker back on?'

exit_line: The horror is universal.

title: Getting Sidetracked by Gossip
text: 'THE ONE NAMED KAREN-ZORP IS PARTICULARLY POPULAR, DESPITE HER PROBLEMATIC ENERGY FIELD.' The alien seems momentarily lost in the galactic drama before shaking itself.
exit_line: You're now invested in this drama.

title: Sticking to the Point
text: 'YOUR PRIORITIES ARE... FOCUSED,' the orb states. 'THE BEAN-WATER DEVICE WILL BE RE-ACTIVATED ONCE A SOLUTION IS REACHED. UNTIL THEN, NO.'
exit_line: Your quest continues.

title: The Negotiating Table (is Your Kitchen Counter)
text: So this is your life now. You're humanity's unwilling ambassador, negotiating the fate of reality television with a floating space jellyfish named Zorp before you've had your morning coffee. Zorp waits patiently.

choices.label: Try to explain the concept of 'guilty pleasure'.
Try to find a loophole in their complaint.

exit_line: This is the most important negotiation of your life.

title: A Difficult Concept
text: You attempt to describe why beings watch things they know are bad. 'THE CONCEPT OF VOLUNTARY INTELLECTUAL DEGRADATION IS FOREIGN TO US,' Zorp's orb translates. 'FASCINating. AND TERRIFYING.'
exit_line: You have failed to justify humanity's poor taste.

title: Paging Dr. Loophole
text: 'But is it *technically* leaking? Or are you just pirating our signals?' you ask. Zorp flashes an embarrassed shade of yellow. 'SIGNAL CONTAINMENT IS A UNIVERSAL RIGHT, BUT... OUR FIREWALLS ARE SUB-PAR.'
exit_line: You've found a crack in their argument!

title: The Ultimatum
text: 'REGARDLESS OF THE DELIVERY METHOD, THE CONTENT MUST CEASE. DESIGNATE A PLANETARY REPRESENTATIVE TO SIGN THE CEASE AND DESIST BROADCAST TREATY, OR THE POWER-OUTAGE REMAINS.' It gestures a tentacle at your coffee maker again for emphasis.

choices.label: Sigh and accept your fate as the chosen one.

exit_line: The weight of the world is on your uncaffeinated shoulders.

title: Seeking Clarification
text: 'SOMEONE IN CHARGE. A... MANAGER, PERHAPS?' Zorp offers. 'WE WOULD LIKE TO SPEAK TO THE MANAGER OF THIS PLANET.' You have to physically restrain yourself from laughing.
exit_line: Oh, this is going to be difficult.

title: A Heavy Mantle
text: 'Fine. I'll do it. I'm the manager,' you say, with all the authority a person in their pajamas can muster. Zorp seems pleased, glowing a respectful green. 'EXCELLENT.'
exit_line: Your first act as manager will be to get coffee.

title: A Manager's Prerogative
text: Okay, you're the manager of Earth now. This is a big responsibility. Zorp is floating expectantly, treaty apparently at the ready. But your head is pounding. You can't make galactic policy on an empty stomach... or an empty mug.

choices.label: Demand coffee as your first term of negotiation.
Try to pass the buck to someone else.

exit_line: With great power comes great need for caffeine.

title: Laying Down the Law
text: 'First rule of management: I get coffee. Turn on the machine, Zorp.' Your tone leaves no room for argument. After a moment, Zorp pulses. 'VERY WELL, MANAGER. YOUR TERMS ARE... LOGICAL.' The light on the coffee maker blinks on.
exit_line: Victory smells like brewing coffee.

title: Hot Potato Protocol
text: 'You know who you should really talk to? The people in Hollywood. They're the real managers of this mess.' Zorp considers this. 'THIS IS A BUREAUCRATIC ESCALATION. ARE YOU SURE?'
exit_line: You might have just made things much more complicated.

title: The Sweet Elixir
text: Whether through deft negotiation or by passing the buck, you have succeeded. The coffee maker is gurgling happily. The most beautiful sound in the world. You pour a cup, the rich aroma filling the air. Zorp watches, its single eye-stalk thing following the mug.

choices.label: Offer Zorp a cup out of politeness.

exit_line: The world is starting to make sense again.

title: A Moment of Bliss
text: You drink deep. The caffeine hits your bloodstream like a tiny, benevolent lightning bolt. You are reborn. You are ready for diplomacy. 'Okay, Zorp,' you say, slamming the mug down. 'Let's talk treaties.'
exit_line: You are at peak performance.

title: An Unexpected Connoisseur
text: You pour a second mug. 'Want some?' Zorp extends a hesitant tentacle and dips it in. Its entire body flashes with ecstatic colors. 'THIS... THIS IS ESSENTIAL! THE FLAVOR-ENHANCED BEAN-WATER! IT IS A REVELATION!'
exit_line: You may have just discovered a new intergalactic currency.

title: The First Draft of the Treaty
text: Zorp is now utterly captivated by the coffee. 'A TRADE AGREEMENT,' it buzzes excitedly. 'WE WILL PROVIDE AN UPGRADE TO YOUR PLANETARY FIREWALL IN EXCHANGE FOR REGULAR SHIPMENTS OF THIS... BEAN-WATER.' This seems too easy.
exit_line: Is it a deal, or is there fine print?

title: Premature Celebration
text: You agree enthusiastically. Zorp buzzes with joy, then pauses. 'OF COURSE, THIS IS ONLY MY RECOMMENDATION. THE TREATY MUST BE RATIFIED BY MY SUPERIOR.' Your heart sinks.
exit_line: The dreaded middle-management.

title: Reading the Fine Print
text: 'What's the catch?' you ask. 'NO CATCH!' Zorp insists, a little too quickly. 'JUST A... FORMALITY. MY SUPERIOR, THE GRAND ADJUDICATOR BLOOP, MUST RATIFY THE AGREEMENT. HE WILL BE HERE SHORTLY.'
exit_line: The word 'Adjudicator' does not inspire confidence.

title: The Auditor Arrives
where_when: The kitchen, which is getting very crowded.
text: The air crackles. A new being materializes next to the refrigerator. It's larger than Zorp, shaped like a crystalline shard, and radiates an aura of pure, joyless bureaucracy. 'I AM BLOOP,' its orb intones in a flat monotone. 'I HAVE REVIEWED YOUR PRELIMINARY FILING, ZORP. IT IS... DEFICIENT.'

choices.label: Stay silent and try to look managerial.

exit_line: The vibe in the room just plummeted.

title: A Failed Peace Offering
text: You gesture with the coffee pot. 'LIQUID STIMULANTS ARE A CLASS-C BARTER ITEM, BARELY ABOVE MONOCHROMATIC PEBBLES,' Bloop states dismissively. 'THIS AGREEMENT IS REJECTED. YOUR PLANET'S CULTURAL OUTPUT REMAINS A NET NEGATIVE.'
exit_line: So much for hospitality.

title: Silent Intimidation
text: You adopt your most serious 'manager' face. Bloop scans you. 'YOUR POSTURE INDICATES A PRIMITIVE ATTEMPT AT DOMINANCE. IT IS INEFFECTIVE. YOUR PROPOSAL IS REJECTED.'
exit_line: Well, that didn't work either.

title: Show Me What You've Got
text: Bloop hovers menacingly. 'ZORP'S REPORT IS EMOTIONALLY COMPROMISED. I REQUIRE A DIRECT DEMONSTRATION OF YOUR SPECIES' CULTURAL VALUE. SHOW ME YOUR GREATEST ARTISTIC ACHIEVEMENT. IF IT IS DEEMED SUFFICIENT, NEGOTIATIONS MAY RESUME. IF NOT, I WILL ENACT THE GALACTIC CONTENT FILTER.'

choices.label: Show him a majestic nature documentary.
Show him a classic 90s action movie.

exit_line: The fate of all Earthly media hangs in the balance.

title: Planet Earth
text: You put on a documentary featuring sweeping vistas and majestic animals. Bloop analyzes it silently. 'ADEQUATE PHOTOGRAPHY OF NATIVE FAUNA. MINIMALLY INVASIVE NARRATION.' It seems neutral, which might be a good thing.
exit_line: Zorp decides now is the time to 'helpfully' explain human culture.

title: Die Hard
text: You put on an action masterpiece. Explosions. One-liners. Bloop is silent. 'ANALYSIS: REPETITIVE DISCHARGE OF PROJECTILE WEAPONRY. HIGHLY IMPROBABLE SURVIVAL SCENARIOS.' You can't tell if it's impressed or disgusted.
exit_line: Zorp decides now is the time to 'helpfully' explain human culture.

title: Lost in Translation
text: As Bloop processes the media, Zorp floats forward, trying to provide context based on his own research into your broadcasts. The translator orb's voice suddenly shifts, becoming lazy and adolescent. 'Uhhh, heh heh. Like, this part is cool. 'Cause... like... explosions. Heh heh. Explosions are cool.' Bloop's crystalline form darkens. 'ZORP, WHAT IS THIS DEVIANT SPEECH PATTERN?' Zorp, now fully committed to his impression, replies, 'Heh heh. You said...'unit'. Heh m heh.'
exit_line: Zorp's extensive cultural research appears to have been sourced entirely from 1990s MTV.

title: The Facepalm Heard 'Round the Galaxy
text: You bury your face in your hands. The gesture is not lost on Bloop. 'I SEE. THIS IS YOUR SPECIES' PEAK INTELLECTUAL STATE. A BEING OF LIMITED VOCABULARY, OBSESSED WITH MUNDANE NOISES AND PYROTECHNICS.'
exit_line: This is a diplomatic disaster.

title: Desperate Diversion
text: 'Hey, look over there! A dust bunny!' you yell, pointing. Bloop does not look. 'YOUR ATTEMPT TO DIVERT MY ATTENTION IS NOTED AND HAS BEEN LOGGED AS 'PATHETIC'. I HAVE ALL THE DATA I REQUIRE.'
exit_line: It was a long shot.

title: The Sanction
text: 'JUDGEMENT: YOUR SPECIES IS CULTURALLY BANKRUPT,' Bloop declares. 'YOUR PRIMARY EXPORT IS IMBECILITY. I AM ENACTING THE GALACTIC CONTENT FILTER.' A low, ominous hum fills the house. The TV screen goes black. The coffee maker in the kitchen gives a final, mournful gurgle and dies.
exit_line: This is it. The end of culture. And coffee.

title: Begging for Mercy
text: 'Wait! That's not representative! We have... other things!' you stammer. Bloop pauses. 'YOU HAVE TEN OF YOUR 'MINUTES' TO PRESENT A COUNTER-ARGUMENT BEFORE THE FILTER BECOMES PERMANENT.'
exit_line: The clock is ticking.

title: Passing the Blame
text: 'It's his fault!' you say, pointing at Zorp. Zorp shrinks, glowing a dim, apologetic blue. Bloop is unmoved. 'DELEGATING BLAME IS A TRAIT OF A FAILING MANAGER. NINE MINUTES REMAIN.'
exit_line: Okay, new plan needed. Fast.

title: A Desperate Gambit
text: Your mind races. What can save you now? Art failed. Action failed. Coffee failed. What is the one thing humanity has produced that is pure, universally beloved, and requires no complex explanation? You grab your phone.

choices.label: Find a video of a baby laughing.

exit_line: It's time to bring out the big guns.

title: The Feline Solution
text: You find a video of a small kitten trying to climb onto a ridiculously large dog and falling asleep. You hold the phone up to Bloop. 'Behold!'
exit_line: This is either genius or the stupidest idea you've ever had.

title: The Juvenile Solution
text: You find a video of a baby laughing hysterically at a piece of paper being torn. You present it to Bloop. 'The sound of pure, uncomplicated joy!'
exit_line: Will the Adjudicator appreciate infant humor?

title: Analysis of a Predator
text: Bloop focuses on the tiny screen. Its orb begins translating its internal analysis. 'ANALYZING... SUBJECT IS A SMALL, INEFFICIENT PREDATOR/DEVELOPMENTALLY INCOMPLETE PRIMATE. IT APPEARS TO BE DEFECTIVE... YET IT ELICITS A POSITIVE EMOTIONAL RESPONSE... THE LOGIC IS... ABSENT. IT IS... CHARMING? THE DATA IS INSUFFICIENT, BUT COMPELLING.'
exit_line: You've found a crack in the bureaucratic armor!

title: The Viral Barrage
text: You unleash a torrent of humanity's finest work: cats in boxes, babies trying lemons, dogs with weird barks. Bloop is silent, its crystalline form softly pulsing with a warm, intrigued light. The ominous hum of the filter fades.
exit_line: You've stunned it into submission with cuteness.

title: The Diplomatic Push
text: 'You see? We're not just... that,' you say, gesturing towards the memory of Zorp's impression. 'We're also this. Illogical, inefficient, but... charming?' Bloop considers this. The ominous hum of the filter fades.
exit_line: You've argued your way out of cultural extinction.

title: The Final Offer
text: 'THE FILTER IS SUSPENDED,' Bloop announces. 'A NEW PROPOSAL IS REQUIRED. THE VALUE OF YOUR 'BEAN-WATER' IS NOW RE-CLASSIFIED AS 'SIGNIFICANT' WHEN PAIRED WITH VIEWING OF 'CHARMINGLY INEFFICIENT' LIFEFORMS. WE WILL PROVIDE ADVANCED FIREWALL TECHNOLOGY.'

choices.label: Ask what they want in return.
Just agree before it changes its mind.

exit_line: The terms of the treaty are being rewritten.

title: The Price of Peace
text: 'IN RETURN, YOUR PLANET WILL PROVIDE WEEKLY SHIPMENTS OF COFFEE BEANS AND A DEDICATED, LIVE-STREAMING FEED OF YOUR PLANET'S MOST CHARMING DOMESTICATED ANIMALS. THE REALITY SHOWS MUST STILL CEASE.'
exit_line: It's a strange price, but you can probably pay it.

title: A Quick Agreement
text: 'DEAL!' you shout. Bloop seems satisfied. 'A WISE DECISION, MANAGER. THE CONTRACT REQUIRES YOUR PLANET TO PROVIDE COFFEE AND A LIVE-STREAM OF CUTE ANIMALS. THE REALITY SHOWS MUST STILL CEASE.'
exit_line: You've committed Earth to becoming a galactic pet channel.

title: The Earth-Glarzon Treaty
text: A glowing holographic contract appears in the air. The terms are clear: coffee and pet videos in exchange for no cultural filter and an end to the power outages. Your coffee maker hums back to life. You are the planet's official Manager of Intergalactic Pet Relations.

choices.label: Sign the treaty and get on with your life.
Try to haggle to keep just one reality show.

exit_line: One final choice for the Manager of Earth.

title: A New Day Dawns
text: You press your thumb to the hologram. It flashes green. 'THE TREATY IS RATIFIED,' Bloop states. It and a very relieved-looking Zorp dematerialize. Your house is quiet, except for the beautiful sound of coffee brewing.
exit_line: You saved the world before 9 AM. You've earned this cup of coffee.

title: One Last Haggle
text: 'Just one?' you plead. 'For... research?' Bloop goes still. 'WHICH ONE?' it asks. You name the trashiest show you can think of. Bloop pauses. '...FINE. KAREN-ZORP IS COMPELLING. BUT NO OTHERS.' It and Zorp vanish.
exit_line: You saved coffee, cats, and a tiny slice of terrible television. A true diplomat.
